column6: b'THE NEW YORK TIMES TECHNOLOGY'

column10: b"This Renaissance man's invention of the maritime lock allowed Milan to link with the Po river via a canal system"
column11: b'As is often said, you can\'t be a little bit this, also called "in a family way"'
column12: b'(Mr. Pogue points a handheld projector at a screen.) Micro projectors are tiny, but at short range they give you a nearly cinematic experience; they use the same type of DLP technology that\'s replacing film in movie theaters; DLP stands for this type of light processing'
column13: b'He\'s the future governor & labor union president seen here around 1940'
column16: b"Hoping to capitalize on the popularity of Superman was one factor in naming this '70s audio product"
column17: b'A nickname of Rome is this type of "City", an adjective that should not be modified'
column18: b'(David Pogue reads the clue.) You can track your car, your dog or even your teenager with a Zoombak, which pinpoints their location courtesy of this space-based system'
column19: b'Today found on the $10 bill, he was an aide-de-camp to Washington & also served in his cabinet'

column22: b'Fashion designer Jacques Heim called his smallest style the Atom; rival Louis Reard named his after this atoll'
column23: b'This 6-letter word for "one of a kind" should never be preceded by "very"'
column24: b'(David Pogue reads the clue.) A truly green product, the prototype Sony Ericsson Greenheart phone is made of recycled plastic & bioplastic from this most commonly grown U.S. grain'
column25: b'In 1995 astronaut Norman Thagard became the first American to board this Russian space station'
column28: b'Friedrich Jahn of Germany invented this gymnastics event that uses a surface 16 feet long & 4 inches wide'
column29: b'Absolute mathematical terms include parallel & this, indicated by 2 parallel lines'
column30: b'(David Pogue reads the clue.) I\'m holding a Blu-ray DVD player that can also download movies & TV shows from this service that\'s now living up to its name; its CEO has said, "There\'s a reason we didn\'t call the company DVD By Mail"'
column31: b"Though the Constitution says the U.S. can't have one of these, it was the last name of Constitution signer Rufus"
column34: b'This magnetic device was invented in China & used to find the best burial place'
column35: b"It's not just unlikely, it's this, the I in the IM Force"
column36: b'(David Pogue reads the clue.) OLED technology delivers such an incredible picture in such a thin screen because there\'s no backlight needed; each of these 518,400 units making up the image generates its own light'
column73: b'A 1979 third-round draft pick by the 49ers, this QB was Super Bowl MVP 3 times'
column74: b'The dolphin kick is used in competition in this sport'
column75: b'"Hands of Victory", giant crossed swords made from melted guns used in the war against Iran, dominate this city\'s skyline'
column76: b'The "Q" in QSST, a proposed 12-passenger luxury jet, stands for "quiet", as it wouldn\'t produce this 2-word sound'

column80: b'The tucuxi, an under-4-foot dolphin, has been found swimming more than 1,500 miles up this river'

column82: b"Introduced in the 1980s, it's the Boeing jet whose digits add up to 20"
column83: b'Perhaps to keep this president from being lonely, the King of Siam offered him a herd of elephants'

column85: b'This city on the Great Lakes is the only NFL city that has never hosted nor appeared in a Super Bowl'
column86: b'Seen here, this variety of dolphin takes its name from a distinctive facial feature'
column87: b'(Sarah of the Clue Crew points to a map on the monitor.) Completely landlocked & fed by rivers like the Zhem, the Ural & the Volga, this large sea is actually a lake'
column88: b'In the Korean War U.S. F-86 Sabre jets participated in dogfights with these Soviet fighter planes'
column89: b'An open 4-wheeled horse-drawn carriage with a flexible seat'
column90: b'He wrote to the Corinthians, "When I became a man, I put away childish things"'
column91: b'The 1980 Raiders were first to win a Super Bowl after making the playoffs as this, a non-division winner'

column93: b"If you're visiting the rocky promontory called the Giant's Causeway, you're traveling on this island"
column94: b'The A380 from this France-based co. was designed to carry up to 840 passengers; how long does deplaning take?'
column95: b'Whenever Johnny & I wrestle, he climbs up to the top one of these corner-of-the-ring supports & bodyslams me'
column96: b'On Christmas Eve in 1223, this Italian saint set up a nativity scene in Greccio, complete with live animals'
column97: b'In 1988 he became the first African-American quarterback to start & win a Super Bowl'
column98: b'In the 400s B.C. this Greek historian told the story of the rescue of the poet Arion by a dolphin'
column99: b'To see Mario Irarrazabal\'s giant "Hand of the Desert" statue, visit the Atacama Desert in this country'
column100: b'Each turbojet on the Northrop F-5E generates 3,500 pounds of thrust; these "kick in" to boost thrust to 5,000 pounds'
column101: b"This monarch has a troubling dream in the Bible's Book of Daniel"
column102: b'(Jon of the Clue Crew reports from the Santiago de Compostela Cathedral in Spain.) The Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela houses the remains of this saint--"Iago" in Spanish--the traditional evangelizer of Spain'
column134: b'On September 23, 1952 some 60 million people, the largest TV audience to that time, tuned in for this live address'
